conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and relative positions of objects and light source.
Light source is positioned to the front right, casting shadows to the left and slightly forward.
Moving light source to the back left will shift shadows towards the front right.
Shadow A will move to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow B will move to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow C will move to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow D will move to the right and slightly forward.
Shadows will become longer as the light source moves further away from the objects.
Moving light source to the back right will shift shadows towards the front left.
Shadow A will move to the left and slightly forward.
Shadow B will move to the left and slightly forward.
Shadow C will move to the left and slightly forward.
Shadow D will move to the left and slightly forward.
Shadows will also become longer as the light source moves further away from the objects.
Summary: Moving light source to the back left shifts shadows to the front right; to the back right shifts shadows to the front left.
Summary: In both cases, shadows will become longer as the light source moves further away from the objects.
Final Answer: When light source moves to the back left, shadows shift towards the front right and become longer; to the back right, shadows shift towards the front left and become longer.
